content.rendered:
Question: How could two little words have so many meanings? But they do.

I remember that as a child, our family had a record player. It played 45’s and the records were about 1/3 the size of the larger records. The first record that I bought for myself was by Keith Green. I remember that I took all the money that I had at the time and — with the help of the cashier — purchased that album. I’m not sure how many times I listened to it but knowing me, it was probably several.

My brother, on the other hand, had a job and so he purchased a sound system. I liked to use it too. He preferred groups like Meatloaf and others that I don’t recall. I liked love songs from Styx, Chicago and Boston.

When CD’s came out, I got one. It took a while before I actually got a CD player. Or maybe it was the other way around.

My first CD was by Michael Card and I know I drove my sister crazy as I listened to it over and over. I know because she told me.

Keeping: having, owning, holding, possessing or maintaining. If you don’t keep something, you sell it or give it away.

Records: any document — printed material — mental, analog or digital. A record may be a physical piece of paper, but it may also be a memory, a 45 album or a photograph. These are just some examples. A $1 bill is a record of a certain percentage of value based on something. It used to be gold, but I’m not sure what it is now.

First Corinthians tells us that love, among other things, “it keeps no record of wrongs.” It tells us that we may have other gifts and we may do great things, “but do not have love, I gain nothing.”

The Bible also tells us that God is love. So, it could be said that if we do not have God, we do not have love and therefore we gain nothing from this life that we live.

What’s required to find God?

Scripture: it could be Genesis 1: 1 that says, “In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.” (KJV)
Faith: so if you believe in your heart what God says, you have part of it.
Confession: It’s confession that, one, I am a sinner and that I need God’s help and, second, that I put my faith in the completed work of the only Son of God. If Jesus was just a teacher or a good guy, he could’t save anyone. And if you think about it, he really did clam to be equal to God and that’s why they killed Jesus.

I don’t remember my prayer because I was too shy to pray out loud. I did believe in my heart, though, and the confession came soon after at baptism. And, if you don’t know, baptism cannot save anyone. Tongues are not a sign of being born again; they are simply a gift for self edification and, perhaps, for the church. I think things like serving and teaching, giving to the church are more prevalent gifts these days. Healing would be nice, but I think it goes back to faith, not need.

Here’s a sample prayer: “God, forgive me. I confess that I am a sinner and that I need Your forgiveness. I accept your gift of salvation that you offer because of the promise in John 3: 16 (“For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.” — KJV). Thank you for this free gift.”

When you do this, you are sealed with the Holy Spirit, Saved and given eternal life. It’s so simple, and adult can get it.

If you have questions, please email me: ralfie517@gmail.com. Put “Question” in the “about” line. If you have a prayer request, put “Prayer”. If you just want to let me know that you’ve put your faith in Jesus, put “Yes.” This will help me sort though all of the junk that I get to find what I really need to focus on.
